text.autoconfig.refinedstorage2.title: Refined Storage 2
text.autoconfig.refinedstorage2.option.g: Maximum amount of rows when stretched
Prevent sorting while shift is down
book.refinedstorage2.landing_text: The next generation of Refined Storage.
book.refinedstorage2.category.grids.desc: The Grid allows access to items and fluids in your storage network.
book.refinedstorage2.entry.grids.about.l: The Grid is the block that you'll use the most when interacting with your storage network.$(br2)It provides a view with all the items and fluids in a storage network.$(br2)You can insert and extract resources from the Grid.
book.refinedstorage2.entry.grids.control: Mastering the various controls that the Grid provides is essential to use your storage network efficiently.$(p)Using $(h)LEFT CLICK$() extracts an entire stack, whereas using $(h)RIGHT CLICK$() extracts half of a stack.$(p)Pressing $(h)SHIFT$() while doing this will push the resources to the player inventory instead of the cursor.

$(h)SHIFT + MOUSE SCROLL UP$() will extract an entire stack from the player inventory to the storage network. $(h)SHIFT + MOUSE SCROLL DOWN$() will extract an entire stack from the storage network to the player inventory.$(p)Using $(h)CTRL + MOUSE SCROLL UP$() and $(h)CTRL + MOUSE SCROLL DOWN$() performs the same action, but for a single item.

When it comes to interacting with the search box, you can use $(h)TAB$() to focus the search bar when autoselected mode is turned off.$(p)Using $(h)RIGHT CLICK$() on the search box will clear the search query.
book.refinedstorage2.entry.grids.sorting: The order in which resources are visible is configurable for every Grid. You can use ordering by name, by quantity, by ID and by last modified.$(p)The sorting direction can also be chosen, either ascending or descending.$(p)By default, the Grid is ordering by quantity, descending.
book.refinedstorage2.entry.grids.search_: The search box has a few different modes.$(p)The default one is $(h)Normal$(), which allows the player to click on the search box and type in a search query. The player may also use $(h)TAB$() to focus the search box. The search box can be deactivated again by clicking outside the box or by pressing the $(h)TAB$() key.

There is also $(h)Normal (autoselected)$() which is similar to $(h)Normal$(), but automatically applies focus when the Grid is opened.$(p)In this mode, the search box can never lose focus, even if the player clicks out of the box or presses $(h)TAB$().

When Roughly Enough Items is installed, search box modes $(h)REI$() and $(h)REI (autoselected)$() are available as well.$(p)They behave the same way as the other search box modes, but synchronize changes from the Grid search box to the REI search box.

$(h)REI (two-way)$() and $(h)REI (two-way autoselected)$() modes will ensure that changes from the REI search box are synchronized to the Grid search box, and also changes from the Grid search box to the REI search box.

When the search box is focused, the player may use the $(h)UP$() and $(h)DOWN$() keys to scroll through the history of the search box.$(p)Losing focus or pressing $(h)ENTER$() in the search box will save the search query in the history.$(p)Even if the Grid is closed and reopened, the history remains.

By default, when opening and closing the Grid, the search query is cleared. You may retrieve the previous search query by using the $(h)UP$() arrow key.$(p)If the last search query needs to be present without pressing $(h)UP$(), then the player can modify the $(h)grid.rememberSearchQuery$() configuration option.
By default, the Grid uses all the available screen space. This is because $(h)Stretched$() mode is chosen. There are a few additional modes available: $(h)Small$() (3 rows), $(h)Medium$() (5 rows) and $(h)Large$() (8 rows).$(p)When using the $(h)Stretched$() size, the Grid will use all available screen space. This can be limited with the $(h)grid.maxRowsStretch$() config option.
